Posts.Content: Hi, just thought i'd ask? Had my mastectomy in Aug and just wonderedhow long before the swelling and fluid takes to go completely? It had got better and yes it was numb right around my side but now it's only around the arm pit does it ever go?? Dee p,s yes i do the exercises.
Posts.Title: fluid/swelling

Posts.Content: Hi, The Gaviscon did the trick so far i only seemed to have acid for about three days and now(for now lol) it's gone, Due to have second chemo tomorrow(15th Oct) the hospital have just rang to ask if i feel ok due to the white cells been high, I feel ok! I did have to have an injection last week to help boost me and i know i'll have to go back the day after chemo to have another one. My hair has all but gone now and i do think it i started when i was having problems with the white blood count that is when my hair started falling out, I must admit and i know this might sound odd, But it does fascinate me how many different side effects there are and how the body fights this, Hmm i know it's sounds odd but the body is a law unto it's self don't you think? Hope everyone is doing ok? Dee.
Posts.Title: Acid

Posts.Content: Can anyone help! I ve been looking(in vain) for a sticker to place on my bike/car but i'm not having much luck i see you can buy loads from America but i only want two!! Dee
Posts.Title: Acid

Posts.Content: Hi,I've had one session of chemo so far next one due 15th Oct all being well. My problem is, Although i'm havinging some side effects and can cope with those my main problem-so far is Acid,I rang my GP and he perscribed Gaviscon which helps for a short while but is there anything else i can do to calm it down? I don't see my doctor untill 15th and don't like to pester the nurses. My treatment is Cycophosphsmide and Taxotere (Docetaxel) Just thought i'd ask on here and see if anyone is having the same problem. Dee
Posts.Title: Acid

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Thanks for the comments, I did in fact get in touch with my GP after talking to the nurse at the Hospital, Although i tried Metoclopramide it didn't help so my GP prescribed Gaviscon and that helped, I've only taken it for about two days and it's gone now. Thanks for your help.
Posts.Title: Acid

Posts.Content: Hello Penny, Thanks for getting in touch, You sound like me at school as i was always larking about(haven't changed really lol.) What web sites do you look at on Google? I know some people would find this worrying or even a little disturbing but i'm fascinated by the body and how it' works i even watched a programme called Autopys on the TV performed by an a German Doctor- Dr Gunther Van Hagens. Then when me and my husband were on a weekend break in Amsterdam he had an exhibition there and my hubby said "oh god, you'll want to go to that?" yip lol.. Again it was fascinating, I do tend to think that this is a journey i'm taking one i never thought i would, so while i have the chance i want to look at it from lots of different ways.Odd! but just like me really lol.. Yes i do pay for perscriptions but the Doc did give me a large bottle and like i said it only lasted for three days so i've got off lightly so far ha ha. I know what your saying about stress but i don't tent to stress about stuff(chemo i mean) As long as they explain everything what there doing and why and what i don't know i'll look up. At one point my hubby was worrying about me looking on the internet and yes you can frighten yourself, But i am too inquisitive and when it's about me i'm like a sponge i need to know if that makes sense? I'm not bothered if my hair falls out, it'll grow back and whats a few months. I hope you don't mind me mentioning but i did read your profile and saw that yours is terminal, Sorry to hear that. You know it gets my back up at times when i'm talking to friends and they say how brave i'm being, I don't think like that, It's people like you who are the brave ones, Sorry if i've stepped out of place i hope your all right with that. it's been nice chatting and i hope my rantting about the body hasn't frightened you off, I'm only a little odd lol.. Best wishes. Dee
Posts.Title: Acid

Posts.Content: Hi, Thought i'd have some in put lol,I watched a programme years ago looking in to the link(if there is one)between breast cancer and deodorant. I don't know about anyone else, but i often wonder what were all doing to our selves due to the amount of chemicals in just about everything.
Posts.Title: sweating-arm pit.

Posts.Content: Since i had my mastectomy i have noticed that i can smell my sweat more coming from my arm pit, up till now i haven't used any deodorant due to the chemo/ radiotherapy, is anyone else having this problem? or can someone recomend a suitable deodorant? I have bought one from holland and barret which is like a crystal/rock sort of thing but doesn't seem to work for me now. Dee.
Posts.Title: sweating-arm pit.

Posts.Content: Hi Seanty, Thanks for the input, but as long as you realsie that i'm not saying that there is a link with deodorants and cancer? I really don't want to scare people when theres no need. Dee
Posts.Title: sweating-arm pit.

Posts.Content: Hi Raincoat, Thanks for the reply and everyone else but i never use spray deodorants anyway as it brings my asthma on, I have been out today and bought a deodorant made by simple and i was told to wash with simple soap while having chemo/radio so i think it'll be fine, but due to still been very soar i still won't be using anything yet on my bad side. I'm also going to type in what you suggest KateG. Dee .
Posts.Title: sweating-arm pit.

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm due to have my first yearly check up after a mastectomy,chemo and radio. My question is this, even though i'm told i will have a mammograme on the remaining breast does anyone know if they ever check the scar where the mastectomy was done? even though the breast isn't there, The reason why i ask is because i sometimes have pain in the scar area and was a little concerned as i also had part of the rib and lung treated during radio as the tumour was growing inward and i also seem to be getting the cough which i had before my breast cancer back, should i ask about this or a i being paranoid? Dee.
Posts.Title: check ups!

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm on tamoxafin for 5yrs and so far only problems i seem to be having are slight leg cramps(which i did point out to the Doctor when she mentioned what tablets i was going to be given) and a little triedness but other than that i'm fine. I've just turned 53 a week ago and WAS still having periods up to my second chemo then they have stopped, but i will keep what you've said in mind as i could have problems with tamoxifin so i'll have to wait and see-5yrs of tablets is a long time.. Dee
Posts.Title: From tamoxifen to arimidex

Posts.Content: Hi, I had a mastectomy in Aug of this year and even after my operation i did have lol.. long hair and i still managed to tie my hair up and i was so pleased that i could because it look awful down. I also had some cording but did my exersices every day and i'm fine although there is still slight swelling under my arm pit which feels odd and uncomfortable at times but it doesn't stop me doing anything and i ride a motorbike.. But please remember everyone is different and we all heal at different times and i'm stobborn which helps me fight and i wouldn't say i was fit before my op but i'm not that unfit either but never went to the gym beofore or after my surgery-hope this helps. Dee.
Posts.Title: mastectomy - can it be pain-free in the long term?

Posts.Content: Hi seaspirit44 and thank you to everyone who answered my question, but it is something you mentioned Seaspirit 44 the lump feels like something fatty and is along my scar I can move it around(not a lot) but nothing like the tumour I had that was hard to the touch and would not move. I have made an appointment for next week at my GP's AND I will let you all know the result. thank you all once again for your concern. x
Posts.Title: Paranoid.

Posts.Content: Hi everyone its a long time since I visited the site I have a concern which I'd like to ask some advice. After my mastectomy in 2008/9 Chemo, radiotherapy followed by Tamoxifen and Letrozol no reconstruction(it's not for me and I'm happy with that.) However about a year after I finished all my treatment apart from medication I returned to work and after a few hiccups with  double pneumonia  broken ribs I was fine until one day I checked my (R) side where I had the mastectomy.where the site of  the tumour is I noticed a small lump about the size of a pea which I have kept my eye on, well. on and off until this week the small size lump is the size of a penny so now I'm not sure what to do, do I visit the GP?  or am I being paranoid :-(   I've also noticed pain going through my chest to my back and yes I cough but I do have asthma, I seem to put everything down to my age all the aches and pains of getting older I have just turned 62yrs old.  I worry because the last time I had an appointment at the hospital (and I'm not sure if this is just me) the kindness and help you receive when you are diagnosed seemed to have disappeared the nurses looking at each other passing glances then being left until your turn was missed then pushed through quickly, I honestly felt like getting up and walking out and I think this is what is putting me off.
Posts.Title: Paranoid.

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Hmmm just asking what you think? I've had my second lot of chemo and over the past week or so(last Wed) i've noticed an ulcer starting inside the bottom eye lid and as i've been watching over the last week it's grown slighty it just feels like i have something moving around in there all the time and now it's started to pulse-more annoying than anything, but as it's been there for over a week i feel stupid mentioning it to the nurse next time i go, But how far do you let things go? Do you think i should just leave it and see how it goes? Dee
Posts.Title: ulcer(eye)

Posts.Content: Thank you for the advice, it's funny because i do suffer from cysts on the outside of my eye never in, come to that have cysts all over as i'm prone to them, breast,ovaries, eyes.. It just made me wonder when this seems to have come up quite quickly i thought it was maybe due to dry eye which you can get wilst having chemo, But i'll ask anyway it can't do any harm can it? Thank you. Dee
Posts.Title: ulcer(eye)

Posts.Content: Just to let you know what happened when i went to the hospital and told them about the small lump in my eye. Mentioned it to the nurse at my last chemo and she told the Doc who in turn gave the nurse eye drops as it sounded as though i had conjunctivitis(which i thought was odd as the Doc never even saw me) So.. as i've had to go and see my GP about my notes for work i showed him the lump and he said it could be a cyst(which i am prone to) and can be removed with an op-later lol..) doesn't give you much faith does it? Dee
Posts.Title: ulcer(eye)

Posts.Content: Hi, Thanks for replying to my message Sammieo, I am infact just starting to develop a bit of a cold(my hubby has been ill with it) but i'll wait to see how bad it gets before i go to the Docs, It is a bit confusing when you finish chemo it's makes me feel as though i'm out on a limb sometimes but thanks you for putting my mind at rest Sammeio. :-)
Posts.Title: finished chemo! colds flu and vitimins

Posts.Content: Hi, When your going through surgery/chemo you have a number to contact your hospital if you have an infection or cold/flu etc..which gives you that bit os reasurrance but when it ends and get cold or flu do you treat it as you did before? I just wonderd as i'm not sure. Dee
Posts.Title: finished chemo! colds flu and vitimins
